website_summaries.verdict: A colorful and charming platforming adventure with something to offer everyone.
pros: Lucky’s adventure to outfox Jinx and his catty kids is a sweet and vibrant journey that younger kids will enjoy exploring, as older kids and parents help to solve this game’s more complicated optional puzzles while discovering hidden collectables along the way
cons: Not multiplayer, so families will have to take turns playing as Lucky

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, fun, and positive game for the whole family.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic game. Played it with the kids and they absolutely love it. Bright and colorful levels, fantastically cute and well designed characters, and engaging fun gameplay make this a must have for any XBox owner. The framerate on the XBox One X is smooth and locked at 60FPS. And after all that, the message of the game, one of perseverance, positive action, and just plain fun is something that we need a lot more of in this world. I got 2, one for us and one for gifting this Christmas. I have a feeling, I am going to need a couple more copies. Do yourself and your family a favor and give this game a try, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson W. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Super Lucky is so cool. Amazing graphics.
customer_reviews.text: The graphics are amazing! What a fun game, my kids can't stop playing and smiling.
customer_reviews.author: Ggggggg

customer_reviews.title: Good for boys & girls, 7-10 age range
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a 7 year-old boy, and he and his 10 year-old sister are obsessed. It is challenging enough to keep them interested, but not too much so. They made it to level 6 after a few days of playing a couple hours a day. They rave about it and got their friends hooked on it too. Would recommend for 7-10 age group, boy or girl.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen G.Top Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Lucky's Super Tale
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived in perfect condition. Super Lucky's Tale is 3D adverture platformer. It is very similar to early 3D platformers like Banjo Kazooie and Super Mario 64 and is performs just as well. It follows Lucky, a fox who has dreamed about becoming a hero, as he accidently gets sucked into a book and needs to stop a family of cats from destroying it. The art style and characters are cute and cartoony and the gameplay is easy, so this is game is great for the whole family. The mailing process was great and the game is a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Thank You Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Household hit
customer_reviews.text: What a great fun game. Take a break from all the shoot em up games and give this one a chance. The main character is cute and the graphics are great with the One X.
customer_reviews.author: Jay73

customer_reviews.title: The kids love this game
customer_reviews.text: The kids love this game. They started out with not using an Xbox before and now are very familiar with the controls and hand-eye coordination. They are solving problems by trial and error. There is no language barrier. It's clean, positive fun.
customer_reviews.author: James G.

customer_reviews.title: Nice game but didn't come with instructions book inside case
customer_reviews.text: My husband ordered this game for me as part of my mothers day gifts and i just got it on Tuesday and just opened it up on Thursday for my 6 year old little girl to try it out. The first thing I noticed upon opening it up was that it didn't come with a book on how to play it so she had questions about the game that i couldn't answer so i just told her to get the coins, the graphics are really nice and its definitely kid friendly but I just wish it came with an instruction book like all the other games.
customer_reviews.author: Shetta H.

customer_reviews.title: Good game but
customer_reviews.text: Good and fun but can be a bit hard for younger children.. character is in space and get to fall to his death quite easily..u lose ur position in the game easily. Not easy to know the path u need to take and ur next mission.
customer_reviews.author: Scorpio

customer_reviews.title: One Player
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this game. I have never played it, but they enjoy it. The only down side (which is big if you have more than one child wanting to play) is that it is just a one player game.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Momma

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: My six-year-old likes this game. He has been playing on an Xbox One for about a year. The game is challenging enough and hold his interest. He has had to learn to be patient because when you die and haven’t made it to the next level you have to start over with that particular level. Other games he has grown a custom to do not play this way. The graphics are brightly colored & actually pretty.
customer_reviews.author: R.McConville

customer_reviews.title: Super Lucky's tale is a fun game
customer_reviews.text: Super Lucky's tale is a fun game! I've found it's just plain fun. If you go in expecting a family friendly platformer that you can pick up and play whenever, it's awesome. If you go in expecting groundbreaking deep plot, need lots of thought to get through, you're going to be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mighty Shilling

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this game
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this game! I don’t play video games much but was attracted when I saw the previews of the game and this is a great game for anyone. Graphics are amazing too.

customer_reviews.title: I do recommend it for younger kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for a 7 year old and he loves it! I do recommend it for younger kids, but it's fun to play and the older ones will be playing it too.

They couldn't be more happier.

customer_reviews.title: Noice
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice game. Will try it on the X when it arrives to compare the clarity between the One Elite if there is any significance. Reminds me of Tails. UPDATE 11/29/17- This game is beautiful and challenging. You will have to devote some time to go through this one. The camera is stif and some of the airborne enemies are dead on tough and precise. The level intricacies are layered ontotop of glorious layers. A kid will get tired of this one I guess adults are to have a go at it. This game might be seriously underrated.

customer_reviews.title: Very hard and poorly designed game.
customer_reviews.text: I am a pretty experienced gamer (30+ years). I was really looking forward to playing this game, as I am a big fan of platformers. Let me say: this game is SHORT, the camera is horrible, the difficulty level was harder than I was expecting ( my son got upset because it was too difficult), and the controls were some of the worst I’ve seen in a modern game. Unresponsive and wonky at the best times, completely traitorous at the worst times. I am EXTREMELY disappointed with this game. Sad.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Patrick

customer_reviews.title: A bit hard for my 8 year old son to ...
customer_reviews.text: A bit hard for my 8 year old son to play. Hard to figure what you have to do to get where u want to be.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too little too late; a dismally chirpy attempt at a great platformer.
customer_reviews.text: A dismal, by the numbers game that doesn't stack up to other recent platformers on other systems. Compared to Mario Odyssey, it's garbage. Compared to Ratchet and Clank, or Jak & Daxter, or really any AAA platformer, this game just doesn't deliver. It's confusing in layout, derivative in design, and just doesn't try hard enough. The camera stinks, too. Buy this and maybe your kids will like it, but if they've played other better platformers, then they will try it and drop it pretty quickly in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money...
customer_reviews.text: My son got bored of it very quickly. I wish I could return it. The view is single perspective pointing front to back which, in my opinion, ruin the game experience... I feel really bad since my son went from loving it to hating it in about 30 minutes...
customer_reviews.author: Big Walt

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyable Game
customer_reviews.text: Bought this game for nephew because he got good grades. He loves everything about this game from character all the way to gameplay. The story is okay nothing too exciting but what can you expect from a game geared towards kids. Don't expect a triple "A" narrative with intricate character development. The story is cute to say the least. The controls are easy for a child to understand and super quick to pick up. Gameplay is okay you're standard platformer formula. Not complaining as I gave a 5 star rating. Mainly because nephew loved and since he was the intended audience I'd be wrong to not give that rating.
customer_reviews.author: Raul Rodriguez

product_meta.title: Super Lucky's Tale - Xbox One
product_meta.description: Platform:Xbox One| Edition:StandardWelcome to Adventure! “Super Lucky’s Tale” is a delightful, playground platformer for all ages that follows Lucky, the ever-optimistic, energetic, and lovable hero, on his quest to find his inner strength and help his sister rescue the Book of Ages from Jinx. Jinx is the scheming and mysterious villain trying to reshape the world, but for what reason? Along the way, encounter a hilarious supporting cast of friends and adversaries. Lucky must confront the nefarious Kitty Litter, Jinx’s mischievous kids – self-taught villains who might not be getting Jinx’s plans quite right. Lucky meets friends and allies along the way too. He meets misplaced Yetis, Kooky Spookies, a village of farming worms, and other colorful friends inhabiting the Book of Ages. Test your skills with puzzles and nerve-wracking obstacle courses. Plus, surprise levels and hidden "foxholes" showing up where you least expect them, challenging Lucky to use his wits and skill. Explore hidden secrets of new worlds with Lucky’s signature burrow move. Dive into unpredictable foxholes, or try devilish side scrolling challenge levels to unlock additional rewards. Head back to the era of classic platformers with challenges players of all skill levels and all ages can enjoy.
feature_bullets: A delightful journey filled with endearing characters. Experience Lucky’s bright, colorful, and immersive world in breathtaking 4K
Hilarious supporting cast of friends and adversaries in a rich, colorful world
Face unpredictable challenges and situations as Lucky’s story unfolds. An adventure players of all ages and skill levels can enjoy
Select games are optimized to take advantage of the world’s most powerful console. Super Lucky’s Tale is Xbox One X Enhanced

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars239 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
